remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过一个专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，它公开作为常规鼠标按钮操作之前可能调用操作的处理程序。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件为已处理，不会被调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将该事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件，可能会引发接收元素上时收到。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果你将标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们将传递中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 如果在类处理中处理该事件，除非你显式将不会调用实例为子事件的处理程序与`handledEventsToo``true`为了附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用除非这些类处理程序已注册到具有签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着，在类处理说明进行操作的所有可能的鼠标按钮。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个按钮特定直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些按钮特定的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法不具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 由于继承的中间类可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]上的事件模式 \* 方法： 此方法提供了一种通过建立类处理程序而不是一个实例处理程序来处理来自派生类匹配的事件。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配的事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定的元素，将会调用处理程序引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 一个类处理适合的方案是处理的事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 由于继承的中间类可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]上的事件模式 \* 方法： 此方法提供了一种通过建立类处理程序而不是一个实例处理程序来处理来自派生类匹配的事件。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配的事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定的元素，将会调用处理程序引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 一个类处理适合的方案是处理的事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 另一个专用于预览事件的情况是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 由于继承的中间类可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]上的事件模式 \* 方法： 此方法提供了一种通过建立类处理程序而不是一个实例处理程序来处理来自派生类匹配的事件。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配的事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定的元素，将会调用处理程序引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 一个类处理适合的方案是处理的事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 另一个专用于预览事件的情况是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 由于继承的中间类可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]上的事件模式 \* 方法： 此方法提供了一种通过建立类处理程序而不是一个实例处理程序来处理来自派生类匹配的事件。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配的事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定的元素，将会调用处理程序引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 一个类处理适合的方案是处理的事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由的事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由于此事件使用隧道路由，具有焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses tunneling routing, the element that has focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际具有焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that has focus. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 密钥处理与其他平台功能，例如发出命令和文本组合进行交互。Key handling interacts with other platform features such as commanding and text composition. 事件是可能无法如期出现在某些控件上的较低级别文本输入的事件。The event is a lower-level text input event that might not behave as expected on certain controls. 这是文本的因为某些控件有控件组合或提供的更高级别的版本的类处理输入处理和相关事件。This is because some controls have control compositing or class handling that provides a higher-level version of text input handling and related events. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 事件通常一起引发或，这对应于按下的某个之一的两个标准鼠标按钮。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 和也是路由的事件，但它们是直接路由的事件，并引发相应的按钮特定事件时事件到达事件路由中的此元素。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 请参阅备注以或。See Remarks for or . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎遵循隧道路由通过元素树，它实际上是直接的路由的事件引发和每个元素树沿遵循。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是报告鼠标按钮特定信息的基础的几个相关事件之一事件，即处理为由事件路由每个元素的附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的自变量公开基础的自变量事件。The arguments of this event expose the arguments of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发的鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将事件侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标按钮事件上的) 视为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件将添加不需要检查鼠标按钮状态 （从左至右，向上向下） 的事件数据中的原始鼠标事件的便利性。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如检查非标准按钮的状态，你可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上上类而不是那些。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly PreviewMouseLeftButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由的事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event PreviewMouseRightButtonUp As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: Occurs when the right mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over this element.

span.span: Occurs when the right mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎遵循隧道路由通过元素树，它实际上是直接的路由的事件引发和每个元素树沿遵循。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是报告鼠标按钮特定信息的基础的几个相关事件之一事件，即处理为由事件路由每个元素的附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的自变量公开基础的自变量事件。The arguments of this event expose the arguments of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发的鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将事件侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标按钮事件上的) 视为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件将添加不需要检查鼠标按钮状态 （从左至右，向上向下） 的事件数据中的原始鼠标事件的便利性。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如检查非标准按钮的状态，你可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上上类而不是那些。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly PreviewMouseRightButtonUpEvent As RoutedEvent

span.span: Occurs when any mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 事件通常一起引发或，这对应于按下的某个之一的两个标准鼠标按钮。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 和也是路由的事件，但它们是直接路由的事件，并引发相应的按钮特定事件时事件到达事件路由中的此元素。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 请参阅备注以或。See Remarks for or . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于其中鼠标指针位于;因此，如果您收到此事件来自的已设定焦点或捕获元素，鼠标指针实际上可能通过另一个元素。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive this event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: Occurs when the cursor is requested to display.

span.span: Occurs when the cursor is requested to display.

summary.span: This event is raised on an element each time that the mouse pointer moves to a new location, which means the cursor object might need to be changed based on its new position.

span.span: This event is raised on an element each time that the mouse pointer moves to a new location, which means the cursor object might need to be changed based on its new position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 此事件名称引用光标不一定是文本光标 （有时称为插入点）。The cursor being referred to by this event name is not necessarily the text cursor (sometimes known as the insertion point). 相反，此上下文中的光标是声明的屏幕的图形显示与多个可能的输入相关的设备或 Windows 编程中的概念相关的对象。Instead, the cursor in this context is the object that declares the onscreen graphical display related to several possible input-related devices or concepts in Windows programming. 该对象表示由WPF 中的类。That object is represented by the class in WPF. WPF 输入的系统可以更改此光标时它表示鼠标指针的屏幕位置。The WPF input system enables you to change this cursor when it represents the onscreen position of the mouse pointer. 你可以使用从的预定义的值枚举，也可以声明自定义光标以图像文件。You can use predefined values from the enumeration, or you can declare a custom cursor as an image file. 侦听事件不是游标管理的有效技术。Listening for the event is not an efficient technique for cursor management. 相反，每个元素应定义其自己的游标行为与和。Instead, each element should define its own cursor behavior with and . 你应仅依赖于如果你不使用 WPF 框架级别基元素，或中的特殊情况下，基于每个元素中定义的游标行为不满足你的需求。You should only rely on if you are not using the WPF framework-level base elements, or in extraordinary circumstances where defining cursor behavior on a per-element basis does not meet your needs. 有关详细信息在响应中实现的游标行为，请参阅。For more information on implementing cursor behavior in response to , see . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有定义相应隧道事件。There is no defined corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `e`参数被类型化为所有路由的事件数据的公共基类型; 但是，应作为最特定的事件数据类型，则使用有关要引发事件，因为给定的事件数据派生的类包含适用于特定事件时将引发此事件的实际的特定数据属性。The `e` parameter is typed as the common base type for all routed event data; however, the event data should be given as the most specific event data type that is available for the event being raised, because derived classes contain the actual specific data properties that are intended for the specific event when it is raised. 不只是事件; 的状态属性它还标识要引发的路由的事件。 is not just the state properties for the event; it also identifies which routed event to raise. 此事件引发模式和路由的事件数据均不同于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件和数据类，该类通常只包含与事件相关的属性。This event-raising pattern and the routed event data both differ from [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] events and data classes, which typically just contain properties that are related to the event. ## Examples 下面的示例创建事件数据，将事件标识符追加到数据，然后使用事件数据实例引发自定义的路由的事件。The following example creates event data, appends the event identifier to the data, and then uses the event data instance to raise a custom routed event. [!code-csharp[ContentElementsSmorgasbord#RaiseEvent](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContentElementsSmorgasbord/CSharp/page1.xaml.cs#raiseevent)] [!code-vb[ContentElementsSmorgasbord#RaiseEvent](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContentElementsSmorgasbord/visualbasic/page1.xaml.vb#raiseevent)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 最常见的方案使用此[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api](~/includes/tlasharptla-api-md.md)]，在实现[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]"包装器"自定义的路由事件，特别是，当你实现处理程序的"删除"逻辑与关联的事件[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)]级别。The most common scenario for using this [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api](~/includes/tlasharptla-api-md.md)] is when you implement the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] "wrapper" event that is associated with a custom routed event, specifically when you implement the "remove" logic for handlers at the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] level. 下面的示例中这部分阐释了这种情况下的备注。The example that follows this remarks section illustrates this scenario. 如果没有注册的使用匹配方法调用的输入的参数的条件没有处理程序，则调用此方法起任何作用。Calling this method has no effect if there were no handlers registered with criteria that match the input parameters for the method call. 如果多个处理程序附加条件相匹配，仅第一个处理程序事件删除处理程序存储区中。If more than one handler is attached that matched the criteria, only the first handler in the event handler store is removed. 此行为是与一致[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)]行为`-=`运算符。This behavior is consistent with [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] behavior of the `-=` operator. 既不`routedEvent`也不`handler`可能`null`。Neither `routedEvent` nor `handler` may be `null`. 尝试提供上述任意值作为`null`将引发的异常。Attempting to provide either value as `null` will raise an exception. 此方法将忽略`handledEventsToo`参数信息，如果处理程序最初提供添加与启用的已处理事件的处理的签名。This method ignores the `handledEventsToo` parameter information, which is provided if the handler was first added with the signature that enables handling of already-handled events. 删除任一类型的处理程序。Either type of handler is removed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeCommandBindings() cil managed

summary.span: Returns whether serialization processes should serialize the contents of the property on instances of this class.

span.span: Returns whether serialization processes should serialize the contents of the property on instances of this class.

returns.span: if the property value should be serialized; otherwise, .

span.span: if the property value should be serialized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 这将返回`true`如果本地设置。This will return `true` if is locally set. 这`ShouldSerialize`提供方法，因为属性不具有简单的默认值。This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the property does not have a simple default value. 此方法指示属性是否已从其默认值。This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. 如果你正在开发的设计器，或可以开发自己的控件包含通常调用此方法。You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer or developing your own control incorporating a . 有关详细信息，请参阅[使用 ShouldSerialize 和重置方法定义默认值](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/defining-default-values-with-the-shouldserialize-and-reset-methods.md)。For more information, see [Defining Default Values with the ShouldSerialize and Reset Methods](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/defining-default-values-with-the-shouldserialize-and-reset-methods.md).

summary.span: Occurs when the stylus button is pressed while the pointer is over this element.

span.span: Occurs when the stylus button is pressed while the pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入存在特定的关系。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的隧道事件。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly StylusButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: Identifies the routed event.

span.span: Identifies the routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由的事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event StylusEnter As StylusEventHandler

summary.span: Occurs when the stylus enters the bounds of this element.

span.span: Occurs when the stylus enters the bounds of this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)使用直接的事件处理路由策略。 is a [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 在路由过程; 不会引发直接路由的事件相反，它们是在中处理同一个元素引发它们时。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 但是，它们启用路由的事件的行为，如样式中的事件触发器其他的方面。However, they do enable other aspects of routed event behavior, such as event triggers in styles. 尽管跟踪何时触笔进入的元素边界内，此事件能够更确切地报告属性值已更改，不再`false`到`true`针对此元素。Although tracks when the stylus enters the bounds of an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `false` to `true` on this element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入存在特定的关系。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入存在特定的关系。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的隧道事件。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由的事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event TextInput As TextCompositionEventHandler

summary.span: Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

span.span: Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 处理的复合控件的内部实现，此事件可能已被标记。This event might already be marked as handled by the internal implementations of composited controls. 请参阅下面的备注。See Remark below. 事件可能已被处理的复合控件的内部实现标记。The event may already be marked as handled by the internal implementations of composited controls. 例如，是一个复合控件，其中事件已被标记为处理; 中其组合。For example, a is a composited control where the event is already marked as handled; within its compositing. 这么做是因为在控件需要解释某些类型的输入，如箭头键，为具有对该控件的特殊含义。Controls do this because the control needs to interpret some types of input, such as arrow keys, as having special meaning to that control. 如果你使用附加处理程序文本输入的位置的事件，你可能会收到更好的结果。If you use as the event where you attach handlers for text input, you may receive better results. 该技术可以应对大多数情况下，其中控件组合已经此事件标记为已处理和防止接收为由事件路由事件处理程序。This technique circumvents most cases where control composition has already marked this event as handled and prevents your handler from receiving the event along the event route. 事件允许组件或应用程序侦听的文本输入以独立于设备的方式。The event allows a component or application to listen for text input in a device-independent manner. 键盘是主种，但语音、 手写和其他输入的设备也可以引发。The keyboard is the primary means of , but speech, handwriting, and other input devices can also raise . 由于键组合 — 默认键盘或输入的法编辑器-多个键事件可能会引发一个文本输入的事件。Because of key combinations—either in default keyboards or through input method editors—multiple key events might raise just one text input event. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便摘自类的成员列出时为该类继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的隧道事件。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly TextInputEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: Occurs when a finger touches the screen while the finger is over this element.

span.span: Occurs when a finger touches the screen while the finger is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，和事件手指触摸屏幕并移动之前不会发生。By default, the and events do not occur until a finger touches the screen and moves. 手指在屏幕上按住但不移动会导致按并保存行为。Pressing a finger on the screen and holding it without moving it causes the press and hold behavior of a . 按下并保持行为相当于鼠标右键单击。The press and hold behavior is equivalent to a mouse right-click. 若要使和事件发生只要的手指触摸屏幕上，设置附加到属性`false`此元素。To cause the and events to occur as soon as a finger touches the screen, set the attached property to `false` for this element. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|类型。 of type .| - 对应的隧道事件。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现处理此事件在派生类中的类。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.
